page.title: 19Leicester Great Central Way
page.content: The Great Central Way is now a tarmacadam footpath and cycle way into the City of Leicester. It begins about 5 kilometres to the south of the city centre. It was made as part of a community work scheme. The Great Central Way was originally part of the Midland Region railway network from London to the North of England. Today many people use the Great Central Way for leisure time walks or cycling to work in the city centre. Much of the surrounding land is now landscaped and wildlife is encouraged as much as possible.It is not uncommon to see foxes, rabbits, grey squirrels, stoats and a great variety of birdlife. There are established hawthorn hedgerows as well as newly planted Buddleias and other shrubs.
